newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turkish opposition mulls censure motion.
newsitem.headline: Turkish opposition mulls censure motion.

text.p: The leader of Turkey's main opposition Motherland Party said on Monday he might bring a censure motion against Prime Minister Necmettin Erbakan's Islamist-led coalition next week.
"If the government continues with the same tricks to protect itself, we will propose a censure motion in parliament next week," Anatolian news agency quoted Motherland head Mesut Yilmaz as saying.
He was speaking before a key right-wing party said it would not join a planned caretaker government to take the country to early polls, putting Erbakan's razor-thin majority in parliament in danger.
Erbakan, under pressure from the army in a row over religious activism, last week announced a plan to hand over power to his conservative coalition partner Tansu Ciller.
But he did not set a date and negotiations between the coalition have become bogged down over the exact details of the swap.
Yilmaz said a censure motion would not be needed if the caretaker government were formed.
